newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH FINMIN SUBMITS UTILITIES, MINING SELLOFF PLAN.
newsitem.headline: CZECH FINMIN SUBMITS UTILITIES, MINING SELLOFF PLAN.

text.p: The Czech Finance Ministry has submitted a plan to privatise the country's regional utilities and mining firms to the council of economic ministers, Finance Minister Ivan Pilip said on Thursday.
"I have signed them (the proposals) and sent them to the council of ministers," Pilip said, adding that they would be put on the agenda of the next meeting.
He said it now depended on the term of the next ministers meeting as to when they would be placed on the agenda.
The ministry plan calls for the sale of 15 percent stakes in each of the 16 gas and electricity utilities in a public tender this year. The remainder of the state's holdings should be sold next year.
The government holds controlling stakes in all of the country's utilities.
Coal minining companies Mostecka Uhelna, Severoceske Doly, and Sokolovska Uhelna should be partially sold to their managemnents, and partially in public tenders.
